00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_SEC

00052 struct plain_sec {
00053         struct ptlrpc_sec       pls_base;
00054         rwlock_t            pls_lock;
00055         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *pls_ctx;
00056 };
00057 
00058 static inline struct plain_sec *sec2plsec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00059 {
00060         return container_of(sec, struct plain_sec, pls_base);
00061 }
00062 
00063 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy plain_policy;
00064 static struct ptlrpc_ctx_ops    plain_ctx_ops;
00065 static struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx    plain_svc_ctx;
00066 
00067 static unsigned int plain_at_offset;
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * for simplicity, plain policy rpc use fixed layout.
00071  */
00072 #define PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS             (4)
00073 
00074 #define PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF              (0)
00075 #define PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF              (1)
00076 #define PLAIN_PACK_USER_OFF             (2)
00077 #define PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF             (3)
00078 
00079 #define PLAIN_FL_USER                   (0x01)
00080 #define PLAIN_FL_BULK                   (0x02)
00081 
00082 struct plain_header {
00083         __u8            ph_ver;            /* 0 */
00084         __u8            ph_flags;
00085         __u8            ph_sp;             /* source */
00086         __u8            ph_bulk_hash_alg;  /* complete flavor desc */
00087         __u8            ph_pad[4];
00088 };
00089 
00090 struct plain_bulk_token {
00091         __u8            pbt_hash[8];
00092 };
00093 
00094 #define PLAIN_BSD_SIZE \
00095         (sizeof(struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc) + sizeof(struct plain_bulk_token))
00096 
00097 /****************************************
00098  * bulk checksum helpers                *
00099  ****************************************/
00100 
00101 static int plain_unpack_bsd(struct lustre_msg *msg, int swabbed)
00102 {
00103         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsd;
00104 
00105         if (bulk_sec_desc_unpack(msg, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, swabbed))
00106                 return -EPROTO;
00107 
00108         bsd = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, PLAIN_BSD_SIZE);
00109         if (bsd == NULL) {
00110                 CERROR("bulk sec desc has short size %d\n",
00111                        lustre_msg_buflen(msg, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF));
00112                 return -EPROTO;
00113         }
00114 
00115         if (bsd->bsd_svc != SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL &&
00116             bsd->bsd_svc != SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_INTG) {
00117                 CERROR("invalid bulk svc %u\n", bsd->bsd_svc);
00118                 return -EPROTO;
00119         }
00120 
00121         return 0;
00122 }
00123 
00124 static int plain_generate_bulk_csum(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
00125                                     __u8 hash_alg,
00126                                     struct plain_bulk_token *token)
00127 {
00128         if (hash_alg == BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL)
00129                 return 0;
00130 
00131         memset(token->pbt_hash, 0, sizeof(token->pbt_hash));
00132         return sptlrpc_get_bulk_checksum(desc, hash_alg, token->pbt_hash,
00133                                          sizeof(token->pbt_hash));
00134 }
00135 
00136 static int plain_verify_bulk_csum(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
00137                                   __u8 hash_alg,
00138                                   struct plain_bulk_token *tokenr)
00139 {
00140         struct plain_bulk_token tokenv;
00141         int                     rc;
00142 
00143         if (hash_alg == BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL)
00144                 return 0;
00145 
00146         memset(&tokenv.pbt_hash, 0, sizeof(tokenv.pbt_hash));
00147         rc = sptlrpc_get_bulk_checksum(desc, hash_alg, tokenv.pbt_hash,
00148                                        sizeof(tokenv.pbt_hash));
00149         if (rc)
00150                 return rc;
00151 
00152         if (memcmp(tokenr->pbt_hash, tokenv.pbt_hash, sizeof(tokenr->pbt_hash)))
00153                 return -EACCES;
00154         return 0;
00155 }
00156 
00157 static void corrupt_bulk_data(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00158 {
00159         char           *ptr;
00160         unsigned int    off, i;
00161 
00162         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
00163 
00164         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
00165                 if (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len == 0)
00166                         continue;
00167 
00168                 ptr = kmap(BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page);
00169                 off = BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset & ~PAGE_MASK;
00170                 ptr[off] ^= 0x1;
00171                 kunmap(BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page);
00172                 return;
00173         }
00174 }

00180 static
00181 int plain_ctx_refresh(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00182 {
00183         /* should never reach here */
00184         LBUG();
00185         return 0;
00186 }

00188 static
00189 int plain_ctx_validate(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00190 {
00191         return 0;
00192 }
00193 
00194 static
00195 int plain_ctx_sign(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00196 {
00197         struct lustre_msg   *msg = req->rq_reqbuf;
00198         struct plain_header *phdr;
00199         ENTRY;
00200 
00201         msg->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
00202 
00203         phdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF, 0);
00204         phdr->ph_ver = 0;
00205         phdr->ph_flags = 0;
00206         phdr->ph_sp = ctx->cc_sec->ps_part;
00207         phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg = req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg;
00208 
00209         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
00210                 phdr->ph_flags |= PLAIN_FL_USER;
00211         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
00212                 phdr->ph_flags |= PLAIN_FL_BULK;
00213 
00214         req->rq_reqdata_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(msg->lm_bufcount,
00215                                                  msg->lm_buflens);
00216         RETURN(0);
00217 }
00218 
00219 static
00220 int plain_ctx_verify(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00221 {
00222         struct lustre_msg   *msg = req->rq_repdata;
00223         struct plain_header *phdr;
00224         __u32                cksum;
00225         int                  swabbed;
00226         ENTRY;
00227 
00228         if (msg->lm_bufcount != PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS) {
00229                 CERROR("unexpected reply buf count %u\n", msg->lm_bufcount);
00230                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00231         }
00232 
00233         swabbed = ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req);
00234 
00235         phdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF, sizeof(*phdr));
00236         if (phdr == NULL) {
00237                 CERROR("missing plain header\n");
00238                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00239         }
00240 
00241         if (phdr->ph_ver != 0) {
00242                 CERROR("Invalid header version\n");
00243                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00244         }
00245 
00246         /* expect no user desc in reply */
00247         if (phdr->ph_flags & PLAIN_FL_USER) {
00248                 CERROR("Unexpected udesc flag in reply\n");
00249                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00250         }
00251 
00252         if (phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg != req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg) {
00253                 CERROR("reply bulk flavor %u != %u\n", phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg,
00254                        req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg);
00255                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00256         }
00257 
00258         if (unlikely(req->rq_early)) {
00259                 unsigned int hsize = 4;
00260 
00261                 cfs_crypto_hash_digest(CFS_HASH_ALG_CRC32,
00262                                 lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0),
00263                                 lustre_msg_buflen(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF),
00264                                 NULL, 0, (unsigned char *)&cksum, &hsize);
00265                 if (cksum != msg->lm_cksum) {
00266                         CDEBUG(D_SEC,
00267                                "early reply checksum mismatch: %08x != %08x\n",
00268                                cpu_to_le32(cksum), msg->lm_cksum);
00269                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00270                 }
00271         } else {
00272                 /* whether we sent with bulk or not, we expect the same
00273                  * in reply, except for early reply */
00274                 if (!req->rq_early &&
00275                     !equi(req->rq_pack_bulk == 1,
00276                           phdr->ph_flags & PLAIN_FL_BULK)) {
00277                         CERROR("%s bulk checksum in reply\n",
00278                                req->rq_pack_bulk ? "Missing" : "Unexpected");
00279                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00280                 }
00281 
00282                 if (phdr->ph_flags & PLAIN_FL_BULK) {
00283                         if (plain_unpack_bsd(msg, swabbed))
00284                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00285                 }
00286         }
00287 
00288         req->rq_repmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0);
00289         req->rq_replen = lustre_msg_buflen(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF);
00290         RETURN(0);
00291 }
00292 
00293 static
00294 int plain_cli_wrap_bulk(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00295                         struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00296                         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00297 {
00298         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsd;
00299         struct plain_bulk_token     *token;
00300         int                          rc;
00301 
00302         LASSERT(req->rq_pack_bulk);
00303         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount == PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS);
00304 
00305         bsd = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00306         token = (struct plain_bulk_token *) bsd->bsd_data;
00307 
00308         bsd->bsd_version = 0;
00309         bsd->bsd_flags = 0;
00310         bsd->bsd_type = SPTLRPC_BULK_DEFAULT;
00311         bsd->bsd_svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
00312 
00313         if (bsd->bsd_svc == SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL)
00314                 RETURN(0);
00315 
00316         if (req->rq_bulk_read)
00317                 RETURN(0);
00318 
00319         rc = plain_generate_bulk_csum(desc, req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg,
00320                                       token);
00321         if (rc) {
00322                 CERROR("bulk write: failed to compute checksum: %d\n", rc);
00323         } else {
00324                 /*
00325                  * for sending we only compute the wrong checksum instead
00326                  * of corrupting the data so it is still correct on a redo
00327                  */
00328                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CHECKSUM_SEND) &&
00329                     req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg != BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL)
00330                         token->pbt_hash[0] ^= 0x1;
00331         }
00332 
00333         return rc;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static
00337 int plain_cli_unwrap_bulk(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00338                           struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00339                           struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00340 {
00341         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsdv;
00342         struct plain_bulk_token     *tokenv;
00343         int                          rc;
00344         int                          i, nob;
00345 
00346         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
00347         LASSERT(req->rq_pack_bulk);
00348         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount == PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS);
00349         LASSERT(req->rq_repdata->lm_bufcount == PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS);
00350 
00351         bsdv = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_repdata, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00352         tokenv = (struct plain_bulk_token *) bsdv->bsd_data;
00353 
00354         if (req->rq_bulk_write) {
00355                 if (bsdv->bsd_flags & BSD_FL_ERR)
00356                         return -EIO;
00357                 return 0;
00358         }
00359 
00360         /* fix the actual data size */
00361         for (i = 0, nob = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
00362                 if (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len +
00363                     nob > desc->bd_nob_transferred) {
00364                         BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len =
00365                                 desc->bd_nob_transferred - nob;
00366                 }
00367                 nob += BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len;
00368         }
00369 
00370         rc = plain_verify_bulk_csum(desc, req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg,
00371                                     tokenv);
00372         if (rc)
00373                 CERROR("bulk read: client verify failed: %d\n", rc);
00374 
00375         return rc;
00376 }
00377 
00378 /****************************************
00379  * sec apis                             *
00380  ****************************************/
00381 
00382 static
00383 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *plain_sec_install_ctx(struct plain_sec *plsec)
00384 {
00385         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *ctx, *ctx_new;
00386 
00387         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ctx_new);
00388 
00389         write_lock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00390 
00391         ctx = plsec->pls_ctx;
00392         if (ctx) {
00393                 atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);
00394 
00395                 if (ctx_new)
00396                         OBD_FREE_PTR(ctx_new);
00397         } else if (ctx_new) {
00398                 ctx = ctx_new;
00399 
00400                 atomic_set(&ctx->cc_refcount, 1);       /* for cache */
00401                 ctx->cc_sec = &plsec->pls_base;
00402                 ctx->cc_ops = &plain_ctx_ops;
00403                 ctx->cc_expire = 0;
00404                 ctx->cc_flags = PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED | PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE;
00405                 ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid = 0;
00406                 spin_lock_init(&ctx->cc_lock);
00407                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ctx->cc_req_list);
00408                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ctx->cc_gc_chain);
00409 
00410                 plsec->pls_ctx = ctx;
00411                 atomic_inc(&plsec->pls_base.ps_nctx);
00412                 atomic_inc(&plsec->pls_base.ps_refcount);
00413 
00414                 atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);  /* for caller */
00415         }
00416 
00417         write_unlock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00418 
00419         return ctx;
00420 }
00421 
00422 static
00423 void plain_destroy_sec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00424 {
00425         struct plain_sec *plsec = sec2plsec(sec);
00426         ENTRY;
00427 
00428         LASSERT(sec->ps_policy == &plain_policy);
00429         LASSERT(sec->ps_import);
00430         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_refcount) == 0);
00431         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_nctx) == 0);
00432         LASSERT(plsec->pls_ctx == NULL);
00433 
00434         class_import_put(sec->ps_import);
00435 
00436         OBD_FREE_PTR(plsec);
00437         EXIT;
00438 }
00439 
00440 static
00441 void plain_kill_sec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00442 {
00443         sec->ps_dying = 1;
00444 }
00445 
00446 static
00447 struct ptlrpc_sec *plain_create_sec(struct obd_import *imp,
00448                                     struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svc_ctx,
00449                                     struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00450 {
00451         struct plain_sec       *plsec;
00452         struct ptlrpc_sec      *sec;
00453         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *ctx;
00454         ENTRY;
00455 
00456         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_POLICY(sf->sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_POLICY_PLAIN);
00457 
00458         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(plsec);
00459         if (plsec == NULL)
00460                 RETURN(NULL);
00461 
00462         /*
00463          * initialize plain_sec
00464          */
00465         rwlock_init(&plsec->pls_lock);
00466         plsec->pls_ctx = NULL;
00467 
00468         sec = &plsec->pls_base;
00469         sec->ps_policy = &plain_policy;
00470         atomic_set(&sec->ps_refcount, 0);
00471         atomic_set(&sec->ps_nctx, 0);
00472         sec->ps_id = sptlrpc_get_next_secid();
00473         sec->ps_import = class_import_get(imp);
00474         sec->ps_flvr = *sf;
00475         spin_lock_init(&sec->ps_lock);
00476         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sec->ps_gc_list);
00477         sec->ps_gc_interval = 0;
00478         sec->ps_gc_next = 0;
00479 
00480         /* install ctx immediately if this is a reverse sec */
00481         if (svc_ctx) {
00482                 ctx = plain_sec_install_ctx(plsec);
00483                 if (ctx == NULL) {
00484                         plain_destroy_sec(sec);
00485                         RETURN(NULL);
00486                 }
00487                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_put(ctx, 1);
00488         }
00489 
00490         RETURN(sec);
00491 }
00492 
00493 static
00494 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *plain_lookup_ctx(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00495                                         struct vfs_cred *vcred,
00496                                         int create, int remove_dead)
00497 {
00498         struct plain_sec       *plsec = sec2plsec(sec);
00499         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *ctx;
00500         ENTRY;
00501 
00502         read_lock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00503         ctx = plsec->pls_ctx;
00504         if (ctx)
00505                 atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);
00506         read_unlock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00507 
00508         if (unlikely(ctx == NULL))
00509                 ctx = plain_sec_install_ctx(plsec);
00510 
00511         RETURN(ctx);
00512 }
00513 
00514 static
00515 void plain_release_ctx(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00516                        struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, int sync)
00517 {
00518         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_refcount) > 0);
00519         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_nctx) > 0);
00520         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) == 0);
00521         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec == sec);
00522 
00523         OBD_FREE_PTR(ctx);
00524 
00525         atomic_dec(&sec->ps_nctx);
00526         sptlrpc_sec_put(sec);
00527 }
00528 
00529 static
00530 int plain_flush_ctx_cache(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00531                           uid_t uid, int grace, int force)
00532 {
00533         struct plain_sec       *plsec = sec2plsec(sec);
00534         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *ctx;
00535         ENTRY;
00536 
00537         /* do nothing unless caller want to flush for 'all' */
00538         if (uid != -1)
00539                 RETURN(0);
00540 
00541         write_lock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00542         ctx = plsec->pls_ctx;
00543         plsec->pls_ctx = NULL;
00544         write_unlock(&plsec->pls_lock);
00545 
00546         if (ctx)
00547                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_put(ctx, 1);
00548         RETURN(0);
00549 }
00550 
00551 static
00552 int plain_alloc_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00553                        struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00554                        int msgsize)
00555 {
00556         __u32 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS] = { 0, };
00557         int   alloc_len;
00558         ENTRY;
00559 
00560         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF] = sizeof(struct plain_header);
00561         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = msgsize;
00562 
00563         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
00564                 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_USER_OFF] = sptlrpc_current_user_desc_size();
00565 
00566         if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
00567                 LASSERT(req->rq_bulk_read || req->rq_bulk_write);
00568                 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF] = PLAIN_BSD_SIZE;
00569         }
00570 
00571         alloc_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens);
00572 
00573         if (!req->rq_reqbuf) {
00574                 LASSERT(!req->rq_pool);
00575 
00576                 alloc_len = size_roundup_power2(alloc_len);
00577                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, alloc_len);
00578                 if (!req->rq_reqbuf)
00579                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00580 
00581                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = alloc_len;
00582         } else {
00583                 LASSERT(req->rq_pool);
00584                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= alloc_len);
00585                 memset(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, alloc_len);
00586         }
00587 
00588         lustre_init_msg_v2(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens, NULL);
00589         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0);
00590 
00591         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
00592                 sptlrpc_pack_user_desc(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_USER_OFF);
00593 
00594         RETURN(0);
00595 }
00596 
00597 static
00598 void plain_free_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00599                        struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00600 {
00601         ENTRY;
00602         if (!req->rq_pool) {
00603                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00604                 req->rq_reqbuf = NULL;
00605                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = 0;
00606         }
00607         EXIT;
00608 }
00609 
00610 static
00611 int plain_alloc_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00612                        struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00613                        int msgsize)
00614 {
00615         __u32 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS] = { 0, };
00616         int alloc_len;
00617         ENTRY;
00618 
00619         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF] = sizeof(struct plain_header);
00620         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = msgsize;
00621 
00622         if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
00623                 LASSERT(req->rq_bulk_read || req->rq_bulk_write);
00624                 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF] = PLAIN_BSD_SIZE;
00625         }
00626 
00627         alloc_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens);
00628 
00629         /* add space for early reply */
00630         alloc_len += plain_at_offset;
00631 
00632         alloc_len = size_roundup_power2(alloc_len);
00633 
00634         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, alloc_len);
00635         if (!req->rq_repbuf)
00636                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00637 
00638         req->rq_repbuf_len = alloc_len;
00639         RETURN(0);
00640 }
00641 
00642 static
00643 void plain_free_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00644                        struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00645 {
00646         ENTRY;
00647         OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, req->rq_repbuf_len);
00648         req->rq_repbuf = NULL;
00649         req->rq_repbuf_len = 0;
00650         EXIT;
00651 }
00652 
00653 static
00654 int plain_enlarge_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00655                          struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00656                          int segment, int newsize)
00657 {
00658         struct lustre_msg      *newbuf;
00659         int                     oldsize;
00660         int                     newmsg_size, newbuf_size;
00661         ENTRY;
00662 
00663         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
00664         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= req->rq_reqlen);
00665         LASSERT(lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0) ==
00666                 req->rq_reqmsg);
00667 
00668         /* compute new embedded msg size.  */
00669         oldsize = req->rq_reqmsg->lm_buflens[segment];
00670         req->rq_reqmsg->lm_buflens[segment] = newsize;
00671         newmsg_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(req->rq_reqmsg->lm_bufcount,
00672                                          req->rq_reqmsg->lm_buflens);
00673         req->rq_reqmsg->lm_buflens[segment] = oldsize;
00674 
00675         /* compute new wrapper msg size.  */
00676         oldsize = req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF];
00677         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = newmsg_size;
00678         newbuf_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount,
00679                                          req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens);
00680         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = oldsize;
00681 
00682         /* request from pool should always have enough buffer */
00683         LASSERT(!req->rq_pool || req->rq_reqbuf_len >= newbuf_size);
00684 
00685         if (req->rq_reqbuf_len < newbuf_size) {
00686                 newbuf_size = size_roundup_power2(newbuf_size);
00687 
00688                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(newbuf, newbuf_size);
00689                 if (newbuf == NULL)
00690                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00691 
00692                 /* Must lock this, so that otherwise unprotected change of
00693                  * rq_reqmsg is not racing with parallel processing of
00694                  * imp_replay_list traversing threads. See LU-3333
00695                  * This is a bandaid at best, we really need to deal with this
00696                  * in request enlarging code before unpacking that's already
00697                  * there */
00698                 if (req->rq_import)
00699                         spin_lock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
00700 
00701                 memcpy(newbuf, req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00702 
00703                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00704                 req->rq_reqbuf = newbuf;
00705                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = newbuf_size;
00706                 req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf,
00707                                                 PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0);
00708 
00709                 if (req->rq_import)
00710                         spin_unlock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
00711         }
00712 
00713         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF,
00714                                      newmsg_size);
00715         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
00716 
00717         req->rq_reqlen = newmsg_size;
00718         RETURN(0);
00719 }
00720 
00721 /****************************************
00722  * service apis                         *
00723  ****************************************/
00724 
00725 static struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx plain_svc_ctx = {
00726         .sc_refcount    = ATOMIC_INIT(1),
00727         .sc_policy      = &plain_policy,
00728 };
00729 
00730 static
00731 int plain_accept(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00732 {
00733         struct lustre_msg   *msg = req->rq_reqbuf;
00734         struct plain_header *phdr;
00735         int                  swabbed;
00736         ENTRY;
00737 
00738         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_POLICY(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) ==
00739                 SPTLRPC_POLICY_PLAIN);
00740 
00741         if (SPTLRPC_FLVR_BASE(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) !=
00742             SPTLRPC_FLVR_BASE(SPTLRPC_FLVR_PLAIN) ||
00743             SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_TYPE(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) !=
00744             SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_TYPE(SPTLRPC_FLVR_PLAIN)) {
00745                 CERROR("Invalid rpc flavor %x\n", req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
00746                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
00747         }
00748 
00749         if (msg->lm_bufcount < PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS) {
00750                 CERROR("unexpected request buf count %u\n", msg->lm_bufcount);
00751                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
00752         }
00753 
00754         swabbed = ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req);
00755 
00756         phdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF, sizeof(*phdr));
00757         if (phdr == NULL) {
00758                 CERROR("missing plain header\n");
00759                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00760         }
00761 
00762         if (phdr->ph_ver != 0) {
00763                 CERROR("Invalid header version\n");
00764                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00765         }
00766 
00767         if (phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg >= BULK_HASH_ALG_MAX) {
00768                 CERROR("invalid hash algorithm: %u\n", phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg);
00769                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00770         }
00771 
00772         req->rq_sp_from = phdr->ph_sp;
00773         req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg = phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg;
00774 
00775         if (phdr->ph_flags & PLAIN_FL_USER) {
00776                 if (sptlrpc_unpack_user_desc(msg, PLAIN_PACK_USER_OFF,
00777                                              swabbed)) {
00778                         CERROR("Mal-formed user descriptor\n");
00779                         RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
00780                 }
00781 
00782                 req->rq_pack_udesc = 1;
00783                 req->rq_user_desc = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_USER_OFF, 0);
00784         }
00785 
00786         if (phdr->ph_flags & PLAIN_FL_BULK) {
00787                 if (plain_unpack_bsd(msg, swabbed))
00788                         RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
00789 
00790                 req->rq_pack_bulk = 1;
00791         }
00792 
00793         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0);
00794         req->rq_reqlen = msg->lm_buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF];
00795 
00796         req->rq_svc_ctx = &plain_svc_ctx;
00797         atomic_inc(&req->rq_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00798 
00799         RETURN(SECSVC_OK);
00800 }
00801 
00802 static
00803 int plain_alloc_rs(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int msgsize)
00804 {
00805         struct ptlrpc_reply_state   *rs;
00806         __u32                        buflens[PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS] = { 0, };
00807         int                          rs_size = sizeof(*rs);
00808         ENTRY;
00809 
00810         LASSERT(msgsize % 8 == 0);
00811 
00812         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF] = sizeof(struct plain_header);
00813         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = msgsize;
00814 
00815         if (req->rq_pack_bulk && (req->rq_bulk_read || req->rq_bulk_write))
00816                 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF] = PLAIN_BSD_SIZE;
00817 
00818         rs_size += lustre_msg_size_v2(PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens);
00819 
00820         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00821 
00822         if (rs) {
00823                 /* pre-allocated */
00824                 LASSERT(rs->rs_size >= rs_size);
00825         } else {
00826                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(rs, rs_size);
00827                 if (rs == NULL)
00828                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00829 
00830                 rs->rs_size = rs_size;
00831         }
00832 
00833         rs->rs_svc_ctx = req->rq_svc_ctx;
00834         atomic_inc(&req->rq_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00835         rs->rs_repbuf = (struct lustre_msg *) (rs + 1);
00836         rs->rs_repbuf_len = rs_size - sizeof(*rs);
00837 
00838         lustre_init_msg_v2(rs->rs_repbuf, PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens, NULL);
00839         rs->rs_msg = lustre_msg_buf_v2(rs->rs_repbuf, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0);
00840 
00841         req->rq_reply_state = rs;
00842         RETURN(0);
00843 }
00844 
00845 static
00846 void plain_free_rs(struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs)
00847 {
00848         ENTRY;
00849 
00850         LASSERT(atomic_read(&rs->rs_svc_ctx->sc_refcount) > 1);
00851         atomic_dec(&rs->rs_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00852 
00853         if (!rs->rs_prealloc)
00854                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(rs, rs->rs_size);
00855         EXIT;
00856 }
00857 
00858 static
00859 int plain_authorize(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00860 {
00861         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00862         struct lustre_msg_v2      *msg = rs->rs_repbuf;
00863         struct plain_header       *phdr;
00864         int                        len;
00865         ENTRY;
00866 
00867         LASSERT(rs);
00868         LASSERT(msg);
00869 
00870         if (req->rq_replen != msg->lm_buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF])
00871                 len = lustre_shrink_msg(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF,
00872                                         req->rq_replen, 1);
00873         else
00874                 len = lustre_msg_size_v2(msg->lm_bufcount, msg->lm_buflens);
00875 
00876         msg->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
00877 
00878         phdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_HDR_OFF, 0);
00879         phdr->ph_ver = 0;
00880         phdr->ph_flags = 0;
00881         phdr->ph_bulk_hash_alg = req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg;
00882 
00883         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
00884                 phdr->ph_flags |= PLAIN_FL_BULK;
00885 
00886         rs->rs_repdata_len = len;
00887 
00888         if (likely(req->rq_packed_final)) {
00889                 if (lustre_msghdr_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT)
00890                         req->rq_reply_off = plain_at_offset;
00891                 else
00892                         req->rq_reply_off = 0;
00893         } else {
00894                 unsigned int hsize = 4;
00895 
00896                 cfs_crypto_hash_digest(CFS_HASH_ALG_CRC32,
00897                         lustre_msg_buf(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF, 0),
00898                         lustre_msg_buflen(msg, PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF),
00899                         NULL, 0, (unsigned char *)&msg->lm_cksum, &hsize);
00900                 req->rq_reply_off = 0;
00901         }
00902 
00903         RETURN(0);
00904 }
00905 
00906 static
00907 int plain_svc_unwrap_bulk(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00908                           struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00909 {
00910         struct ptlrpc_reply_state   *rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00911         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsdr, *bsdv;
00912         struct plain_bulk_token     *tokenr;
00913         int                          rc;
00914 
00915         LASSERT(req->rq_bulk_write);
00916         LASSERT(req->rq_pack_bulk);
00917 
00918         bsdr = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00919         tokenr = (struct plain_bulk_token *) bsdr->bsd_data;
00920         bsdv = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00921 
00922         bsdv->bsd_version = 0;
00923         bsdv->bsd_type = SPTLRPC_BULK_DEFAULT;
00924         bsdv->bsd_svc = bsdr->bsd_svc;
00925         bsdv->bsd_flags = 0;
00926 
00927         if (bsdr->bsd_svc == SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL)
00928                 return 0;
00929 
00930         rc = plain_verify_bulk_csum(desc, req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg,
00931                                     tokenr);
00932         if (rc) {
00933                 bsdv->bsd_flags |= BSD_FL_ERR;
00934                 CERROR("bulk write: server verify failed: %d\n", rc);
00935         }
00936 
00937         return rc;
00938 }
00939 
00940 static
00941 int plain_svc_wrap_bulk(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00942                         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00943 {
00944         struct ptlrpc_reply_state   *rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00945         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsdr, *bsdv;
00946         struct plain_bulk_token     *tokenv;
00947         int                          rc;
00948 
00949         LASSERT(req->rq_bulk_read);
00950         LASSERT(req->rq_pack_bulk);
00951 
00952         bsdr = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00953         bsdv = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, PLAIN_PACK_BULK_OFF, 0);
00954         tokenv = (struct plain_bulk_token *) bsdv->bsd_data;
00955 
00956         bsdv->bsd_version = 0;
00957         bsdv->bsd_type = SPTLRPC_BULK_DEFAULT;
00958         bsdv->bsd_svc = bsdr->bsd_svc;
00959         bsdv->bsd_flags = 0;
00960 
00961         if (bsdr->bsd_svc == SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL)
00962                 return 0;
00963 
00964         rc = plain_generate_bulk_csum(desc, req->rq_flvr.u_bulk.hash.hash_alg,
00965                                       tokenv);
00966         if (rc) {
00967                 CERROR("bulk read: server failed to compute "
00968                        "checksum: %d\n", rc);
00969         } else {
00970                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CHECKSUM_RECEIVE))
00971                         corrupt_bulk_data(desc);
00972         }
00973 
00974         return rc;
00975 }

00978         .refresh                = plain_ctx_refresh,
00979         .validate               = plain_ctx_validate,
00980         .sign                   = plain_ctx_sign,
00981         .verify                 = plain_ctx_verify,
00982         .wrap_bulk              = plain_cli_wrap_bulk,
00983         .unwrap_bulk            = plain_cli_unwrap_bulk,
00984 };

00986 static struct ptlrpc_sec_cops plain_sec_cops = {
00987         .create_sec             = plain_create_sec,
00988         .destroy_sec            = plain_destroy_sec,
00989         .kill_sec               = plain_kill_sec,
00990         .lookup_ctx             = plain_lookup_ctx,
00991         .release_ctx            = plain_release_ctx,
00992         .flush_ctx_cache        = plain_flush_ctx_cache,
00993         .alloc_reqbuf           = plain_alloc_reqbuf,
00994         .free_reqbuf            = plain_free_reqbuf,
00995         .alloc_repbuf           = plain_alloc_repbuf,
00996         .free_repbuf            = plain_free_repbuf,
00997         .enlarge_reqbuf         = plain_enlarge_reqbuf,

01000 static struct ptlrpc_sec_sops plain_sec_sops = {
01001         .accept                 = plain_accept,
01002         .alloc_rs               = plain_alloc_rs,
01003         .authorize              = plain_authorize,
01004         .free_rs                = plain_free_rs,
01005         .unwrap_bulk            = plain_svc_unwrap_bulk,
01006         .wrap_bulk              = plain_svc_wrap_bulk,
01007 };
01008 
01009 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy plain_policy = {
01010         .sp_owner               = THIS_MODULE,
01011         .sp_name                = "plain",
01012         .sp_policy              = SPTLRPC_POLICY_PLAIN,
01013         .sp_cops                = &plain_sec_cops,
01014         .sp_sops                = &plain_sec_sops,
01015 };
01016 
01017 int sptlrpc_plain_init(void)
01018 {
01019         __u32 buflens[PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS] = { 0, };
01020         int rc;
01021 
01022         buflens[PLAIN_PACK_MSG_OFF] = lustre_msg_early_size();
01023         plain_at_offset = lustre_msg_size_v2(PLAIN_PACK_SEGMENTS, buflens);
01024 
01025         rc = sptlrpc_register_policy(&plain_policy);
01026         if (rc)
01027                 CERROR("failed to register: %d\n", rc);
01028 
01029         return rc;
01030 }
01031 
01032 void sptlrpc_plain_fini(void)
01033 {
01034         int rc;
01035 
01036         rc = sptlrpc_unregister_policy(&plain_policy);
01037         if (rc)
01038                 CERROR("cannot unregister: %d\n", rc);
01039 }
